name: Knife
description: From a grox butcher's chopper to an assassin's stiletto, any number of small bladed weapons can qualify as a 'Knife'. This includes any blades that may be affixed to a weapon as a bayonet.

name: Psykana Mercy Blade
description: Sanctioned Psykers are provided with a sharp blade, a last resort for those whose powers go beyond their control. Should the unfortunate face the tragedy of imminent daemonic possession, the blade offers them a last, merciful escape. A Psykana Mercy Blade has the same profile as a Knife, but has AP -1 and the ADEPTUS ASTRA TELEPATHICA Keyword.

name: Sword
description: As ancient and varied as the Imperium of Man itself, Swords of all shapes and sizes can be found throughout the war-torn universe.

name: Chainsword
description: Despite their brutal appearance and distinctive rasping roar, Chainswords require training to be most effective. A duel between two trained Chainsword wielders is a sight to behold, as they alter the speed and direction of the spinning teeth to counter, parry, and ultimately overcome their opponent with savage grace.

name: Power Sword
description: Rare weapons reserved for heroes of renown and officers of great endeavour, the energy arcing along the edge of a Power Sword is both a warning and a challenge to all who stand against its bearer.

name: Death Cult Power Blade
description: These matched pairs of slender Power Blades are wielded by Death Cult Assassins. Each is perfectly balanced for speed and precision, allowing the wielder to strike with blinding swiftness.

name: Power Axe
description: Similar in design and function to a Power Sword, the Power Axe trades the finesse of a blade for the heavy, bone-crushing impact of an axe head. The disruption field that wreathes the head allows it to cleave through armour and bone alike.

name: Force Stave
description: Though many Force weapons take on a similar form to their mundane counterparts, the Force Stave is designed specifically to work as a psychic conduit. When wielded by a psyker, the stave becomes an extension of their will, crackling with warp energy.

name: Choppa
description: A Choppa is usually little more than a chunk of metal with an edge hacked and filed into one side. Orks wield these brutal weapons with enthusiasm, making up for any lack of craftsmanship with sheer ferocity.

name: Kustom Choppa
description: A Kustom Choppa has been worked over by a Mekboy, strengthened and sharpened until it is deadlier than its more common counterparts. Some feature power fields, buzzing teeth, or other 'improvements'.

name: Witchblade
description: A Witchblade is a masterwork of Aeldari craftsmanship — a blade that resonates with the psychic power of its wielder. In the hands of a psyker, the blade's edge becomes impossibly sharp, slicing through armour as though it were gossamer.

name: Omnissian Axe
description: More a symbol of office than a weapon, the Omnissian Axe is nonetheless a potent tool of war. These two-handed power axes are wielded by Tech-Priests as both sacred icons of the Machine God and as formidable weapons.

name: Chain Bayonet
description: Mounted beneath the barrel of a ranged weapon, a Chain Bayonet allows its user to make devastating close-range attacks. The roaring teeth tear through flesh and light armour with equal ease.

name: Arc Maul
description: Favoured by Skitarii Alpha units, the Arc Maul discharges a powerful electrical shock upon impact. The crackling energy is particularly effective against machinery and armoured targets.

name: Astartes Combat Knife
description: This large, exceptionally sharp blade is carried by many Space Marines as part of their standard issue armament. Similar in size to a regular Human's short sword, this knife has a monomolecular edge that never dulls and always cuts true.

name: Laspistol
description: Small, easy to handle and reliable, Laspistols are the go-to sidearm for countless souls. The snapping retort of the humble Laspistol can be heard echoing across the battlefields and back alleys of the Imperium, often serving as the final holdout for the great and small.

name: Lasgun
description: Lasguns are the most widely manufactured and modified of Humanity's weapons. While the standard issue Mars Pattern Lasgun can be found all across the Imperium, near countless other patterns exist. Despite their unique eccentricities, all of these doughty rifles share a common ancestry.

name: Hot-Shot Lasgun
description: Favoured by elite forces who value penetrating power over volume of fire, the Hot-Shot Lasgun trades ammunition capacity for increased damage output. The searing beams can punch through armour that would stop a regular lasgun shot.

name: Hot-Shot Laspistol
description: A smaller, more compact version of the Hot-Shot Lasgun, favoured by officers and specialists who need a sidearm with genuine stopping power. Though limited in range, its armour-piercing capabilities make it a valued backup weapon.

name: Autopistol
description: From cheap, mass-produced revolvers to sophisticated automatic pistols, Autopistols are a common sight throughout the galaxy. They fire solid slugs propelled by chemical propellants, and are valued for their simplicity and reliability.

name: Autogun
description: The Autogun is a solid projectile weapon that fires metal slugs from a high-capacity magazine. Though lacking the stopping power of more advanced weapons, Autoguns are cheap to produce and easy to maintain.

name: Bolt Pistol
description: All the shock and awe of a fully fledged bolt weapon within a compact casing. Assault specialists facing off against dangerous foes or officers looking to make a fearsome statement favour these powerful and compact weapons.

name: Boltgun
description: Though cumbersome in the hands of lesser mortals, Boltguns — sometimes simply called 'Bolters' — were built for Astartes. These all-purpose rifles are extensions of a Space Marine's body.

name: Heavy Bolt Pistol
description: Wielded by Primaris Marines and other elite warriors, the Heavy Bolt Pistol fires larger, more powerful rounds than its predecessor. The increased calibre delivers devastating impact at close range.

name: Bolt Rifle
description: The standard weapon of Primaris Intercessors, the Bolt Rifle combines extended range with the brutal stopping power of bolt weaponry. Each round is a miniature rocket that detonates within its target.

name: Shoota
description: Shootas are large, loud, and inaccurate weapons that make up for their lack of precision with volume of fire. The signature weapon of Ork Boyz, a Shoota spits out a hail of large-calibre rounds.

name: Slugga
description: A Slugga is a simple, brutish weapon that fires solid ammunition using primitive chemical propellants. Orks favour Sluggas for their satisfying bang and the intimidating size of the rounds they fire.

name: Kustom Slugga
description: A Kustom Slugga has been modified by a Mekboy with bigger barrels, more dakka, and whatever other 'improvements' the Ork deemed necessary. The result is louder, shootier, and more likely to blow up in your face.

name: Shuriken Pistol
description: Shuriken Pistols fire volleys of razor-sharp monomolecular discs capable of slicing through flesh and armour alike. Though small, these elegant weapons are deadly in skilled hands.

name: Shuriken Catapult
description: The Shuriken Catapult is the primary weapon of Aeldari Guardians, firing a stream of crystalline shuriken that can slice through armour with ease. The weapon uses a gravitic accelerator to launch its deadly projectiles.

name: Lasblaster
description: Lasblasters are lightweight laser weapons used by Aeldari Corsairs and other light infantry. Though less powerful than shuriken weapons, they offer superior range and are easier to maintain.

name: Ranger Long Rifle
description: Used by Aeldari Rangers who have chosen to walk the Path of the Outcast, these long-barrelled rifles fire a single, devastatingly accurate shot. The weapon is designed for patient hunters who prefer to kill from afar.

name: Radium Pistol
description: Radium weapons fire solid shells laced with radioactive isotopes. Even a near miss can prove fatal as the radiation poisons the target over time. The weapons are as dangerous to their wielders as their targets.

name: Hand Cannon
description: Hand Cannons are oversized pistols that fire heavy-calibre rounds with tremendous stopping power. Though the recoil can be punishing for untrained users, the damage they deal is devastating.

name: Stubber
description: Stub weapons are among the most basic solid projectile firearms. Simple, cheap, and easy to maintain, Stubbers are common sidearms for civilians, gangers, and others who lack access to military-grade hardware.

name: Avenger Shuriken Catapult
description: A larger, more powerful version of the standard shuriken catapult, the Avenger variant is used exclusively by Dire Avengers. Its extended barrel and enhanced firing mechanism deliver a deadlier stream of monomolecular discs.

name: Shuriken Rifle
description: A precision variant of shuriken weaponry, the Shuriken Rifle trades the rapid-fire capability of the catapult for extended range and improved accuracy, making it ideal for marksmen.

name: Death Spinner
description: Death Spinners project a cloud of monofilament wire that wraps around victims and slices them to ribbons. Used by Warp Spiders, these terrifying weapons leave nothing but bloody remains.

name: Dragon Fusion Gun
description: These short-ranged but devastatingly powerful weapons are wielded by Fire Dragons. The fusion gun fires a superheated blast capable of melting through the thickest armour in an instant.

name: Reaper Launcher
description: A heavy missile launcher used by Dark Reapers, the Reaper Launcher fires armour-piercing missiles with unerring accuracy. Each shot is guided by the Aspect Warrior's supernatural aim.

name: Fusion Pistol
description: A compact version of the fusion gun, the Fusion Pistol sacrifices range for portability. Despite its small size, it retains the devastating armour-melting capabilities of its larger counterpart.

name: Wraithcannon
description: Wraithcannons open a brief rift into the warp, pulling the target's soul into the immaterium. Only Wraithguard constructs possess the psychic fortitude to wield these terrifying weapons.

name: Splinter Rifle
description: The standard weapon of Drukhari Kabalite Warriors, Splinter Rifles fire crystalline shards coated in virulent toxins. Even a minor wound can prove fatal as the poison spreads through the victim's body.

name: Splinter Pistol
description: A compact sidearm favoured by Drukhari warriors, the Splinter Pistol delivers the same toxic payload as its larger counterparts. Perfect for delivering a paralysing or lethal dose at close range.

name: Shardcarbine
description: An advanced variant of splinter weaponry, the Shardcarbine fires a rapid stream of toxic shards. Used by Scourges and other elite Drukhari units, it offers improved rate of fire without sacrificing lethality.

name: Shrieker Cannon
description: Used by Harlequin Death Jesters, the Shrieker Cannon fires bio-explosive shuriken that detonate within the victim's body, causing horrific damage and a terrifying death scream.

name: Neuro Disruptor
description: The Neuro Disruptor fires a beam that liquefies the victim's brain, leaving their body an empty husk. A favourite of Harlequin Shadowseers, it brings swift but agonising death.

name: Stinger Pistol
description: A weapon of the Haemonculi covens, the Stinger Pistol fires crystalline splinters containing exotic venoms. These toxins cause excruciating pain while keeping the victim conscious — the better to savour their suffering.

name: Hallucinogen Grenade Launcher
description: Used by Harlequin Shadowseers, this weapon launches grenades that release psychotropic gases. Victims are overwhelmed by terrifying hallucinations, rendering them helpless with fear.

name: Banshee Blade
description: The signature weapon of the Howling Banshees, these Power Swords are perfectly balanced for swift, deadly strikes. When combined with the Banshee's psychic scream, no armour can withstand their assault.

name: Scorpion's Chainsword
description: Wielded by Striking Scorpions, these chainswords are designed for close-quarters combat. The weapon's teeth are sharpened to a molecular edge, capable of shredding flesh and light armour alike.

name: Guardian Chainsword
description: Standard close-combat weapons issued to Craftworld Guardians, these chainswords are lighter than their Imperial counterparts but no less deadly in skilled Aeldari hands.

name: Singing Spear
description: A Singing Spear is a psychically-attuned weapon that can be hurled at the enemy and will return to its wielder's hand. The spear hums with psychic energy as it flies, hence its name.

name: Ghostsword
description: Wielded by Wraithblades, Ghostswords are massive blades that channel the spirit stone's rage into devastating strikes. The weapons are sized for the towering Wraith constructs.

name: Hekatarii Blade
description: The weapon of choice for Wyches of the Drukhari Wych Cults, Hekatarii Blades are designed for graceful combat in the arenas of Commorragh. Speed and precision are prized over brute force.

name: Hellglaive
description: The signature weapon of Hellion gangs, the Hellglaive is a two-handed polearm designed for swooping attacks from skyboards. Its curved blade can decapitate a victim with a single pass.

name: Agoniser
description: Agonisers are weapons designed to inflict maximum pain while keeping the victim conscious. Each strike delivers a concentrated dose of toxins that overwhelm the nervous system with agony.

name: Klaive
description: The signature weapon of the Incubi, a Klaive is a two-handed power glaive of exceptional craftsmanship. Each is a masterwork, handed down through generations of these elite warriors.

name: Huskblade
description: A Huskblade drains the life force of its victims, leaving behind only withered husks. These terrifying weapons are prized status symbols among Drukhari Archons and Succubi.

name: Archite Glaive
description: A massive polearm wielded by Succubi in the gladiatorial arenas of Commorragh. The Archite Glaive requires great strength to wield effectively, but its reach and power make it devastating.

name: Harlequin's Kiss
description: The Harlequin's Kiss is a tube containing a monofilament wire that, when activated, unspools into the victim's body at high velocity, liquefying their internal organs in an instant.

name: Harlequin's Caress
description: The Harlequin's Caress generates a molecular disruption field that phases through armour, causing catastrophic damage to whatever lies beneath. A gentle touch can prove instantly fatal.

name: Harlequin's Embrace
description: The Harlequin's Embrace wraps around the victim in coils of monofilament wire, slicing them apart as the Harlequin dances away. It is as graceful as it is deadly.

name: Miststave
description: The weapon of Harlequin Shadowseers, the Miststave channels psychic energy to cloud the minds of enemies. Those struck find their thoughts scattered and their reactions slowed.

name: Void Sabre
description: Favoured by Corsair Princes and other Aeldari pirates, the Void Sabre is a masterfully crafted blade designed for elegant duelling. Each is unique, often passed down through noble bloodlines.

name: Scissorhand
description: Haemonculi often replace their hands with Scissorhands — bladed appendages dripping with virulent toxins. These surgical tools double as weapons of exquisite cruelty.

name: Glimmersteel Blade
description: Wielded by Mandrakes, Glimmersteel Blades are forged in the shadow dimension from which these creatures emerge. The blades seem to drink the light around them.

name: Astartes Chainsword
description: Scaled up for the enhanced physiology of Space Marines, the Astartes Chainsword features a more powerful motor and larger teeth than its standard counterpart. The weapon's roar heralds death.

name: Chainfist
description: A Chainfist combines the crushing grip of a Power Fist with the ripping teeth of a chainblade. Designed for breaching fortifications, it can tear through bulkheads and armoured vehicles alike.

name: Crozius Arcanum
description: The weapon of a Chaplain is also their badge of office. This skull-headed power mace is a symbol of the Chaplain's authority to enforce spiritual discipline, and a tool for crushing the Emperor's enemies.

name: Eviscerator
description: These massive two-handed chainswords are favoured by the Ecclesiarchy and zealous warriors seeking to cleave the enemies of the Emperor in twain. The Eviscerator's oversized teeth can carve through power armour.

name: Force Axe
description: A Force Axe channels the psychic might of its Librarian wielder into every swing. The weapon's blade crackles with warp energy, cleaving through armour and soul alike.

name: Force Sword
description: The blade of choice for many Librarians, the Force Sword allows its wielder to channel devastating psychic energy with precision. A single strike can sunder body and spirit.

name: Heavy Thunder Hammer
description: An oversized variant of the already-devastating Thunder Hammer, this two-handed weapon releases a thunderclap of energy upon impact. Only the strongest warriors can wield such a weapon effectively.

name: Lightning Claws
description: Lightning Claws are power weapons in the form of gauntlets fitted with long, razor-sharp talons. The disruption field that wraps each claw allows them to shred armour with every swipe.

name: Power Fist
description: A Power Fist is a massive armoured gauntlet surrounded by a disruptive power field. The weapon's crushing grip can pulp a man in an instant and punch through the thickest armour plate.

name: Relic Blade
description: These ancient Power Swords have been crafted to exacting standards by master artificers. Each Relic Blade is a Chapter treasure, often with a history stretching back millennia.

name: Thunder Hammer
description: Thunder Hammers release a tremendous blast of energy upon impact. The explosive concussion can reduce armour to scrap and send enemies flying through the air.

name: Accelerator Autocannon
description: Mounted on Invictor Tactical Warsuits and other heavy platforms, the Accelerator Autocannon uses gravitic technology to fire high-calibre rounds at tremendous velocity.

name: Assault Bolter
description: Designed for Inceptor squads, the Assault Bolter is a compact, rapid-fire bolt weapon optimized for close-range engagements. Its high rate of fire makes it devastating against infantry.

name: Assault Plasma Incinerator
description: A lighter variant of the Plasma Incinerator designed for mobile warfare. While slightly less powerful, it allows Hellblasters to maintain fire while advancing.

name: Astartes Shotgun
description: Used by Space Marine Scouts for close-quarters combat, the Astartes Shotgun fires devastating solid-slug ammunition capable of tearing through light armour.

name: Auto Bolt Rifle
description: An automatic variant of the Bolt Rifle favoured by aggressive Intercessors. The Auto Bolt Rifle trades accuracy for volume of fire, laying down a storm of explosive bolts.

name: Bolt Carbine
description: A compact bolt weapon designed for Reivers and other close-quarters specialists. The Bolt Carbine is optimised for assault operations, where manoeuvrability is paramount.

name: Bolt Sniper Rifle
description: Used by Eliminators, the Bolt Sniper Rifle fires specially-crafted hyperfrag, executioner, or mortis rounds. Each shot is precisely aimed, the rifle's silencer muffling the report.

name: Executor Bolt Rifle
description: A heavy variant of the Bolt Rifle that fires mass-reactive rounds with improved armour penetration. The weapon's extended range and hitting power make it ideal for eliminating priority targets.

name: Godwyn Pattern Boltgun
description: The Godwyn Pattern is the standard issue boltgun for most Space Marine Chapters. This tried-and-true design has served the Adeptus Astartes for millennia.

name: Grapnel Launcher
description: Primarily used by Reivers for rapid vertical movement, the Grapnel Launcher can also be used as an improvised weapon. The high-tension cable and hook can cause significant damage.

name: Grav-Cannon
description: The Grav-Cannon uses gravitic technology to crush targets under their own mass. The more heavily armoured the target, the more devastating the effect.

name: Grav-Pistol
description: A compact version of grav weaponry, the Grav-Pistol is favoured by officers and specialists. Despite its small size, it can crush armoured targets with focused gravitational force.

name: Heavy Bolter
description: The Heavy Bolter is a belt-fed weapon that spews a relentless stream of mass-reactive rounds. Its sustained fire can suppress infantry squads and tear through light vehicles.

name: Heavy Bolt Rifle
description: Used by Heavy Intercessors, this variant of the Bolt Rifle fires high-calibre rounds with extended range. The weapon's stopping power makes it ideal for taking down armoured targets.

name: Heavy Melta Rifle
description: An extended-range melta weapon designed for Eradicator squads. The Heavy Melta Rifle can melt through bunker walls and vehicle armour with ease.

name: Hellstorm Bolt Rifle
description: A variant Bolt Rifle designed for aggressive close-support fire. The Hellstorm pattern trades some accuracy for increased rate of fire and ease of use on the move.

name: Las Fusil
description: A precision las weapon used by Eliminators for silent kills. The Las Fusil fires a concentrated beam of energy that burns through targets with surgical precision.

name: Melta Rifle
description: The standard melta weapon of Eradicator squads, the Melta Rifle fires a blast of superheated fusion energy. At close range, nothing can withstand its destructive power.

name: Occulus Bolt Carbine
description: Equipped with advanced targeting systems, the Occulus Bolt Carbine allows Infiltrators to engage targets with enhanced accuracy. The integrated optics feed directly into the Marine's helm display.

name: Plasma Gun
description: The Plasma Gun fires bolts of superheated plasma that can melt through the heaviest armour. Though powerful, the weapon risks catastrophic overheating if pushed beyond its limits.

name: Plasma Incinerator
description: The standard weapon of Hellblaster squads, the Plasma Incinerator delivers devastating volleys of plasma fire. Its improved heat dissipation makes it safer to operate than older designs.

name: Storm Bolter
description: Essentially two boltguns fused together, the Storm Bolter delivers twice the firepower in a compact package. Favoured by Terminators, these weapons lay down punishing suppressive fire.

name: Whip
description: Though rarely lethal, whips are prized for their ability to inflict pain and maintain control over prisoners or slaves. A skilled wielder can strike with unerring accuracy from a considerable distance.

name: Neural Whip
description: Used by Sisters Repentia and other agents of the Ecclesiarchy, Neural Whips deliver agonising neural feedback with every strike. The lash overloads the nervous system, leaving victims writhing in pain.

name: Shock Whip
description: A Shock Whip incorporates power cells that discharge a powerful electric shock upon contact. The combination of kinetic force and electrical discharge makes this weapon exceptionally painful.

name: Shock Maul
description: The standard issue weapon of the Adeptus Arbites, the Shock Maul is designed to subdue rather than kill — though it is more than capable of lethal force. Each strike discharges a powerful electric shock.

name: Power Maul
description: A Power Maul is a club or mace surrounded by a disruptive energy field. Popular among Adeptus Arbites and other law enforcement, these weapons can subdue or kill with equal ease.

name: Dialogus Staff
description: Carried by Sisters Dialogus, this staff incorporates a laud-hailer that can project the voice across a battlefield. It serves as both a symbol of office and a capable weapon in close combat.
notes: Functions as a Symbol of Authority and includes a Laud-Hailer.

name: Ripper Gun
description: Designed for Ogryn auxilia, the Ripper Gun is a drum-fed weapon that can be used as a club in close combat. Its heavy rounds and automatic fire make it devastating at close range.

name: Frag Bombs
description: Oversized grenades designed for Ogryn, Frag Bombs are too heavy for normal humans to throw effectively. When they detonate, the blast scatters deadly shrapnel across a wide area.

name: Kroot Rifle
description: A combination weapon used by Kroot Carnivores, the Kroot Rifle fires solid rounds and features blade attachments for close combat. It reflects the Kroot's practical approach to warfare.
notes: Can also be used as a melee weapon (S+4, 2 ED, 0 AP, Brutal).

name: Blessed Blade
description: Rarely, an Imperial Saint will bless a weapon, imbuing it with a modicum of the holy power of unshakable faith in the God-Emperor. These weapons are closely guarded relics of the Ecclesiarchy, valued for their ability to strike down daemonic foes and granted only to its greatest warriors.

name: Transonic Blade
description: These resonant blades hum with a hostile sonic field, churning the stomachs of all that hear it. When adjusted to the correct resonance, a transonic blade cuts through air and armour alike with the same disturbing swiftness.

name: Transonic Razor
description: Shorter and easier to wield than a transonic blade, a transonic razor is perfect for slipping through an enemies' defenses and slicing through their armour with their eyeball-rattling sonic field.

name: Taser Goad
description: A Taser Goad is a long, sword-like weapon that crackles with the Motive Force it steals from the air. When a Taser Goad impacts its target it releases the caged electricity in a precise paroxysm, imparting the Omnissiah's deadly wrath.

name: Bullgryn Maul
description: Little more than a huge slab of metal shaped into a crude club and fitted with an oversized, Ogryn-suited handle, a Bullgryn Maul is as blunt and efficient. Almost as tall as a Human, the monstrous size and weight of a Bullgryn Maul are its only boons in combat.

name: Condemnor Boltgun
description: A rare weapon that combines the raw power of a Bolter with the Warp-repulsing theurgy of the Emperor's faithful, a Boltgun is combined with an archaic crossbow which fires silver stakes inscribed with sacred sigils of Warp disruption that twist a psyker's vile gifts against them to inflict perilous wounds.

name: Eradication Ray
description: Rare relics of the Dark Age of Technology, the merciless machinery that powers the Eradication Ray is little understood in the 41st Millennium, though its effects are undeniable. Anything caught in the sickly beam produced by an Eradication Ray is disassembled atom by atom and unwritten from reality.

name: Flechette Blaster
description: Spewing a fusillade of micro-darts at short range, Flechette Blasters are the standard sidearm of Sicarian Infiltrators, easily wielded in one hand whilst stalking prey. The flechette ammunition utilises advanced bioelectric technology to hone in on the wielder's target, ensuring those struck by a single bolt are then felled by a thousand more cuts.

name: Grenadier Gauntlet
description: These Ogryn-sized grenade launchers are built to be incredibly stable, and can be safely used as massive bludgeons without risking accidental detonations. Using the same simple firing mechanism as the Ripper Gun, Bullgryns use Grenadier Gauntlets to assault foes with mass explosives from behind impenetrable slabshield walls.

name: Macrostubber
description: Far removed from simpler slug-throwers, each Macrostubber is a highly advanced relic capable of unleashing a hail of bullets. Macrostubbers utilise auto-loading and cooling technologies to ensure the firearm does not buckle or melt despite the intense heat generated by the withering torrent of bullets.

name: Phosphor Serpenta
description: A chemical sidearm of antique design, a Phosphex Serpenta fires searing incendiary bolts that cause toxic conflagrations. Those struck by a salvo of vile phosphor burn quickly as it sizzles through flesh and armour, and those that survive soon find the bright explosive burst makes them an easier target for follow-up shots.

name: Ratling Rifle
description: Though built to a slightly smaller scale to other Imperial weaponry, the long barrel of these sniper rifles stretches beyond a Ratling's height. Though Ratling Rifles are almost universally simple slug throwers, they are deadly in the hands of their sharp-eyed Species.

name: Stubcarbine
description: Combining the advanced machinery of the Mechanicus with the reliability of traditional slug-throwing firearms, the Stubcarbine can unleash a torrent of bullets comparable to a Heavy Stubber despite being small enough to be wielded by a Skitarii.

name: Melta Bomb
description: By compressing sub-molecular technology, a Melta Bomb provides the sunburst intensity of a Melta in a horrifying hand thrown explosion. These explosives can reduce even the thickest of voidship hulls to melting slag in seconds.

name: Mindscrambler Grenade
description: Discharging wild surges of bio-electricity into circuitry and nervous systems alike, Mindscrambler Grenades are equally deadly when used against organic or mechanical foes. A rare instance of ancient Biologis studies being applied directly to weaponry, each grenade contains the replicae organs of a xenos creature capable of producing high current electrical discharges.

name: Shock Grenade
description: Bursting in a deafening explosion of blinding light, Shock Grenades are used to disorient and terrify the unfortunate targets of Primaris Reivers to ensure a devastating charge. A Shock Grenade deals Shock Damage to targets caught in the Blast radius instead of Wounds.
notes: Deals Shock Damage instead of Wounds. Targets that suffer any Shock Damage also suffer the Blinded and Vulnerable Conditions.

name: Master-Crafted Power Sword
description: A Power Sword of exceptional quality, forged by master artificers and blessed by Tech-Priests. These weapons are heirlooms passed down through generations of Space Marine heroes.

name: Master-Crafted Void Sabre
description: The finest blades of the Aeldari Corsairs, these Master-Crafted Void Sabres are legendary weapons. Each is a unique work of art, often with names and histories spanning millennia.

name: Star Glaive
description: A ceremonial weapon wielded by Autarchs and other Craftworld leaders, the Star Glaive is a symbol of authority as much as a weapon. Its blade gleams with captive starlight.

name: Splinter Pods
description: Mounted on skyboards and jetbikes, Splinter Pods fire toxic shards while the pilot focuses on manoeuvring. They provide covering fire for high-speed Drukhari attacks.

name: Plasma Pistol
description: Small enough to be used at close quarters, but with all the destructive capability of a fully fledged Plasma Gun, these rare weapons are normally seen in the hands of officers and close combat specialists who are willing to risk loss of limb for decisive firepower.

name: Axe (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A hafted melee weapon with a wedge- or crescent-shaped blade, intended to apply maximum cutting power to a small cross-section.

name: Flail (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A hafted melee weapon, with one or more chains attached to weighted or spiked heads.

name: Greataxe (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Large, two-handed axes used both as heavy-duty cutting tools and as deadly weapons.

name: Greatsword (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: These long blades require two hands to wield effectively.

name: Navis Hatchet (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Heavy, mono-edged hatchets favoured by the Imperial Navy's elite breacher teams.

name: Repression Baton (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Simple, sturdy plasteel batons used by Arbitrators.

name: Spear (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The most common form of weapon ever devised.

name: Force Rod (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Stout crystalline rods usable as weapons and to store psychic energy.

name: Nemesis Falchion (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Smaller variants of the Nemesis Force Sword, wielded in pairs.

name: Nemesis Force Halberd (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Two-handed weapon with a long adamantium haft and iron and silver blade.

name: Nemesis Force Sword (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The most common weapon wielded by Grey Knights.

name: Nemesis Warding Stave (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Defensive Nemesis weapon with refractor field capabilities.

name: Anointed Halberd (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Blessed weapons of the Adepta Sororitas entrusted to elite Celestians.

name: Astartes Chainsword (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Larger, heavier chainsword constructed to withstand Astartes strength.

name: Chain Knife (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Shorter forms of chainsword, commonly taking the forms of cleavers or machetes.

name: Crozius Arcanum (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Power mace used by Space Marine Chaplains as weapon and badge of office.

name: Executioner Greatblade (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Large two-handed power swords used by the Silent Sisterhood.

name: Frost Axe (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Unique chain weapons from Fenris incorporating diamond-hard ice kraken fangs.

name: Bitey Squig (Ammo)

name: Boom Squig (Ammo)
description: An explosive squig that detonates on impact. Used as ammunition for the Heavy Squig Launcha.

name: Grabbin' Klaw

name: Savage Horns and Hooves
description: The natural weapons of a Squiggoth or similar beast used as a battering ram.

name: Saw Blades
description: Spinning saw blades mounted on Ork vehicles to slice through enemies.

name: Spinnin' Blades
description: Rapidly spinning blades attached to Ork aircraft for close combat.

name: Wreckin' Ball
description: A massive ball of scrap metal swung on a chain to smash enemies.

name: Big Bomb
description: A massive Ork bomb dropped from aircraft.

name: Boom Bomb
description: An Ork bomb dropped from aircraft.

name: Burna Bomb
description: An incendiary Ork bomb dropped from aircraft.

name: Standard Shotgun
description: This ancient and archaic firearm's origins can be traced deep into the annals of Terran history. In the simplest of its multitude of forms the Shotgun is a single-shot projectile weapon. In the wider Imperium it is most comparable to 'Stubber'-type firearms in terms of function. However, unlike other solid projectile weapons, the Shotgun traditionally uses a shell loaded with many smaller projectiles that spread to cover a substantial target area.

name: Combat Shotgun
description: Across the breadth of the Imperium the Combat Shotgun is the favoured firearm of boarding parties of both the Imperial Navy and Astra Militarum. Larger and more robustly constructed than the common Shotgun, the Combat variant is designed specifically for use in battle. It features a magazine feed and is capable of both single shot and fully automatic fire, a collapsible stock for increased manoeuvrability at closer range, and an indomitable stopping power.

name: Artificer Shotgun
description: Among the voidsmen-at-arms of the Imperial Navy, these large pump-action Shotguns are the favoured tool of the experienced officers who lead their forces. These masterfully crafted Shotguns are devastating in the close confines of the naval boarding engagements for which they were designed, repelling corridors of boarders one shot at a time.

name: Auxiliary Shotgun
description: An Auxiliary Shotgun is an underfitting modification that can be attached to most standard-pattern firearms in place of a bayonet. The attachment allows for a single, brutal short-range blast. Note: this weapon requires a full action to reload after every use.

name: Varonia Honorbound Pattern Shotgun
description: Throughout the various vessels of the Varonius Flotilla, the "Honorbound" is perhaps the most commonly found variant of Shotgun-type weaponry. Made available to all crew via security-controlled defence lockers in instances of incursion, this pattern is favoured due to both the multiple functional applications of its design and its ease of use by untrained personnel. Should the user be engaged at close quarters, the weapon's stock is reinforced and contains an elongated ceramite weighted component at its base allowing for the firearm to be utilised as a simple, yet effective, bludgeoning type combat weapon.

name: 'Incisor' Shotgun Pistol
description: Notorious for its sheer destructive power and known colloquially by officers and the junior staff of the Imperial Navy as the 'Incisor', this weapon takes the form of a robust and short-barrelled, yet brutally destructive Pistol. Armed with only a single shot, the Pistol is often worn more for its intimidating appearance and fearsome reputation than it is as a practical sidearm.

name: Varonia Primus Pattern Shotgun
description: The Varonia Primus is a manual pump-action single-shot non-standard variant used most notably by petty officers within the Varonius Flotilla. The body of the weapon is fully enclosed and features an internal magazine that holds eight standard shells or similar sized variant ammunition. One unique feature that differentiates the Varonia Primus from other Shotguns is that it utilises a pistol-style grip and firing mechanism which allows the weapon to be wielded single handed, however this practise is discouraged due to operator risk.

name: Avachrus XII 'Gravefiller' Pattern Shotgun
description: In the illustrious manufactorums of Avachrus, the Shotgun variant known across Gilead by the rank and file of the Astra Militarum as the 'Gravefiller' is produced en masse. The Avachrus XII is a non-standard, fully automatic, drum-fed combat Shotgun, commonly carried by officers and engineers of the Gilead Gravediggers. When operated on fully automatic, its extensive magazine allows it to create a continuous hail of deadly shot which can quickly suppress enemy movement.

name: Avachrus II-B Enochian Sanctified Shotgun
description: Carried by only a handful of bodyguards and servants who protect the hallowed priests and cardinals in the upper echelons of Enoch's many spires, the Avachrus II-B is a rare and illustrious firearm. This variant is a magazine-fed, triple barrelled Combat Shotgun enclosed in a solid adamantium casing and capable of both single and semi-automatic firing. Each completed weapon undergoes a sequence of sacred blessings and sanctification rituals, and is biometrically locked to its designated user.

name: Ork Boomstikk
description: The technological fumbling of the Greenskin menace is well documented by the Magi of the Adeptus Mechanicus. While resembling a crude, oversized imitation of the Imperial Shotgun, the Ork armament is comparable in at least basic function to its vastly superior Imperial counterparts. Unlike the purposefully and stoically built weapons brought forth from the manufactorums by the blessed Adeptus Mechanicus, this foul xenos weapon appears crudely built, barely functional, and inherently defective.

name: Bright Lance
description: The Bright Lance is the pinnacle of laser weaponry, outperforming laser technology of other races in every way. It is a large weapon, requiring a vehicle mount or considerable strength to use effectively, but its destructive power is almost without match.

name: Hawk's Talon
description: A refinement of the Lasblasters used by Swooping Hawks, the Hawk's Talon provides superior stopping power and armour penetration.

name: Scatter Laser
description: A larger, more powerful version of the Lasblaster. While not as powerful as the Bright Lance, it is capable of an astonishing rate of fire.

name: Blaster
description: A rifle-sized weapon effective at short to medium range, the Blaster makes a mockery of armour and flesh alike with Darklight beams, making it popular amongst wealthy Kabalite Warriors and Corsairs.

name: Blast Pistol
description: The smallest Darklight weapon nevertheless packs a devastating punch and causes horrendous wounds for its size.

name: Dark Lance
description: The Dark Lance is the most powerful Darklight weapon available to foot troops and light vehicles. Even seeing its deadly beams can cause permanent eye damage, and there is no armour it cannot penetrate.

name: Shuriken Cannon
description: The heavy Shuriken Cannon may not match the rate of fire of its smaller brethren, but it fires larger blades at higher velocities over great distance, dealing considerable damage.

name: Clawmounted Shuriken Catapult
description: A shuriken catapult integrated into the Scorpion's Claw power fist, allowing Striking Scorpion Exarchs to engage at range without sacrificing melee capability.

name: Shadow Weaver
description: The Shadow Weaver creates a mesh of monofilament wires. The mesh, aimed high and falling to the ground, slices through anything beneath it. It is a potent area-denial weapon, but its size requires an anti-grav platform or Wraith Construct to wield.

name: Shredder
description: This vile weapon fires a rapidly expanding mesh of wickedly barbed monofilament wire which entangles all targets it strikes. Struggling against the wires slowly and painfully slices apart all but the toughest targets.

name: Twin Death Spinners
description: Warp Spider Exarchs carry Twin Death Spinners, attached by mechanical arms to the Exarch's armour. They target and fire semi-autonomously on the Exarch's mental commands, unleashing a storm of monofilament razorwire.

name: Aeldari Flamer
description: Though more fuel efficient than the crude, smoke-belching flame weapons of the Imperium, Aeldari Flamers bring about a similar destructive result.

name: Aeldari Missile Launcher: Starshot Missile
description: The Aeldari Missile Launcher operates on similar principles to those of other races. A devastating anti-armour plasma warhead, the Starshot Missile can blast a hole in bunkers or tanks with equal spectacle.

name: Aeldari Missile Launcher: Sunburst Missile
description: Sunburst Missiles trade raw power for increased blast radius, incinerating troop formations and lightly-armoured vehicles.

name: Haywire Blaster
description: Haywire Blasters are lightweight cannons commonly wielded by Drukhari Scourges who employ them in devastating hit-and-run attacks. They unleash massive electromagnetic blasts capable of frying circuitry and scorching flesh.

name: Phantasm Grenade Launcher
description: These Drukhari Launchers fire gas grenades which cause horrific waking nightmares, the victims' suffering invigorating the Drukhari even before they join the battle.

name: Reaper Launcher: Starshot Missile
description: The specialised missile launcher of the Dark Reapers can fire individual Starshot Missiles. Targeting matrices integrate with the heavy, stabilised armour of the Dark Reaper to ensure deadly accuracy.

name: Reaper Launcher: Starswarm Missile
description: The specialised missile launcher of the Dark Reapers can fire salvoes of Starswarm Missiles. Targeting matrices integrate with the heavy, stabilised armour of the Dark Reaper to ensure deadly accuracy.

name: Starcannon
description: The Starcannon displays a mastery of plasma technology that even the most learned Adeptus Mechanicus Magi cannot fully fathom. It is staggeringly powerful, yet its advanced cooling systems eliminate any risk of overheating.

name: Swooping Hawk Grenade Pack
description: The greaves of Swooping Hawk armour include specialised grenade packs the warrior can trigger as they fly, demolishing defences from above.

name: Vibro Cannon
description: An advanced sonic weapon. Targets violently shake to pieces, and troops and vehicles alike are scattered as the blast ploughs a furrow along the ground. It is a large weapon, requiring a support platform or Wraith Construct to wield effectively.

name: Firepike
description: There is no armour a Fire Dragon Exarch cannot annihilate. They often employ the Firepike, an ornate, elongated fusion weapon with incredible destructive power and surprising range.

name: Guardian Fusion Gun
description: While less powerful than its Fire Dragon counterpart, the standard Fusion Gun issued to Guardian squads is still a mighty anti-armour weapon.

name: Splinter Cannon
description: This heavy weapon fires a torrent of toxic splinters ideal for mowing down lightly armoured enemies. It is commonly mounted on vehicles, but when outfitted with anti-grav suspensors it can be carried by a single Kabalite Warrior.

name: D-Cannon
description: The Distortion Cannon is the heaviest Aeldari Vortex weapon. While fantastically powerful, it is short-ranged, so it must be mounted on an anti-grav platform or Wraith Construct.

name: D-Scythe
description: The Distortion Scythe is a weapon steeped in taboo and suspicion among Aeldari, as it severs the link between body and soul. Souls are cast into the Immaterium, Necron engrams are scrambled beyond repair, and Tyranids can be wholly severed from the Hive Mind.

name: Hexrifle
description: A terrible pandemic once swept through Commorragh, turning victims to crystal. A Haemonculus Coven halted the disease and harnessed the same plague in weapons known as Hexrifles that deliver the same dastardly effect from range.

name: Liquifier Gun
description: A ranged adaptation of the Ichor Injector, the Liquifier Gun sprays gouts of the user's own blood, rendered lethal through Haemonculus alchemy. It spews venom, inflicting Poisoned rather than On Fire.

name: Ossefactor
description: The Ossefactor stimulates rapid bone growth. Originally a tool for Haemonculus fleshcrafting, it was weaponised to tear victims apart with their own skeletons. An Ossefactor's victim impales bystanders with bone lances. Treat the dead target as the source of a Frag Grenade explosion.

name: Aeldari Power Sword
description: Using similar principles to Imperial Power Swords, Aeldari versions are far more aesthetically pleasing and boast superior craftsmanship.

name: Demiklaive
description: A pair of shortened Klaive blades used by Incubi who prefer their killing strike in a flurry of slashes instead of one powerful blow. Demiklaives can be connected to form a single weapon if required.

name: Electrocorrosive Whip
description: Obsession with every possible nuance of suffering led to creating this relative of the Agoniser. Its neuronic circuits deliver painful shocks while its advanced polymer length exudes potent venom into every wound.

name: Executioner
description: Howling Banshee Exarchs have the honour of wielding the Executioner. It is an elegant glaive that makes a mockery of heavy armour. When wielded with both hands, it can cleave even an Astartes warrior in two.

name: Flesh Gauntlet
description: A nightmarish Haemonculus weapon, the Flesh Gauntlet is a claw-shaped glove covered in needles and injector vials filled with volatile hyper-steroidal growth serums. A character who dies by a Flesh Gauntlet is torn apart from the inside, transforming into a twitching pile of unrecognisable meat.

name: Ghostaxe
description: Particularly vengeful Wraithblades favour this weapon, sacrificing defence for destructive capability. The axe head concentrates the power field into a staggering impact.

name: Ghostglaive
description: A two-handed polearm commonly wielded by Wraith Constructs. Ghostglaives are devastating weapons, rending armour while allowing the wielder to parry attacks from any fortunate enough to survive the first blow.

name: Hydra Gauntlets
description: This bizarre weapon is a pair of gloves fashioned from a flexible crystalline weave of unknown, possibly extra-dimensional material. In combat, they transform from glassy smooth to a shifting fractal parade of razor-edged crystal blades no target can anticipate. Hydra Gauntlets treat a target's Defence as 1 lower when attacking.

name: Ichor Injector
description: Ichor Injectors resemble a mechanical claw with a large needle under the 'wrist'. When the claw hits, the needle rams home, injecting the target with the attacker's own alchemically-altered blood. The effects vary: some victims boil from the inside, while others dissolve into puddles of liquid flesh, still alive and twitching.

name: Impaler
description: A large, thrusting polearm with monomolecular-edged blades at the tip. It is a popular Wych weapon, but cumbersome, and often wielded with a Shardnet to make the target easier prey.

name: Knife
description: Drukhari knives take diverse forms, from brutal cleavers to vicious sickles and savage bonesaws. They are stained with their victims' blood, but this does not lessen their keen edge. Drukhari may upgrade a Knife with Traits, doubling the Knife's Value and increasing its Rarity one step.

name: Razorflail: Sword
description: Razorflails resemble ornate, serrated swords. With a touch from the user, the wire holding the blade segments together extends, turning the weapon into a vicious whip of razors. In sword form, it can parry attacks effectively.

name: Razorflail: Whip
description: Razorflails resemble ornate, serrated swords. With a touch from the user, the wire holding the blade segments together extends, turning the weapon into a vicious whip of razors. In the hands of a skilled Wych, the weapon dances around defences, entangling and severing brutally.

name: Shardnet
description: Shardnets are weighted wire mesh covered in vicious hooks and barbs. They administer electric shocks to entangled victims, greatly impairing their ability to defend themselves, while also causing involuntary muscle spasms that cause the hooks to tear deeper. The net deals damage every Turn until the target succeeds on an Opposed Strength Test against the attacker (or DN 5, if the net was thrown), disentangling themself.

name: Scorpion's Claw
description: An elegantly designed Power Fist of overlapping armour plates in a vicious pincer shape, the Scorpion's Claw may also integrate a specialised Shuriken Catapult for ranged engagement.

name: Powerblade
description: Alongside their Death Spinners, Warp Spider Exarchs often wield a pair of Power Blades in case they must engage in melee.

name: Powerglaive
description: Aeldari polearms grown from wraithbone, their metallo-crystalline blades are sheathed in a matter-disrupting energy field. Popular among Asuryani who have trained in close combat Aspect Warrior Paths.

name: Mindphase Gauntlet
description: A Mindphase Gauntlet resembles an emaciated, skeletal hand. It counts as an unarmed attack and does not deal damage conventionally. Instead, it saps strength and willpower. A character hit by a Mindphase Gauntlet must pass a DN 3 Willpower Test or lose 1 Willpower until the end of combat. Multiple hits stack.

name: Jester's Blade
description: This powered blade, attached to the barrel of a Death Jester's Shrieker Cannon, turns the heavy weapon into a reaping scythe.

name: Venom Blade
description: Curved blades popular with Drukhari nobility. Toxin vials attach to sockets on the hilt, exuding venom from countless micropores across the weapon's surface, ensuring each strike delivers a full payload of poison.

name: Witch Staff
description: A slender, elegant polearm of wraithbone, housing a psychically reactive matrix in its core. The wielder's force of will amplifies each strike, turning a simple staff into an engine of devastation.

name: Fusion Charge
description: Bulky devices used by Fire Dragons to crack the heaviest armour. The shaped charge must be attached carefully, taking a Full-Round Action, but the catastrophic damage they deliver makes the risk worthwhile. May only target vehicles and structures.

name: Hallucinogen Grenade
description: Harlequin Shadowseers employ these grenades on and off the battlefield. When performing mythic plays and stories, the psychotropic gas of these grenades fully immerses the audience in the production. In battle, the effect leaves enemies in disarray.

name: Haywire Grenade
description: These grenades emit a massive electromagnetic blast over a short distance. Non-Asuryani vehicles are heavily damaged as unprotected electronics burn out. Organic enemies are unharmed. May only target vehicles.

name: Phantasm Grenade
description: Only the strongest wills can resist these Drukhari weapons without environmental protection. The gas evokes nightmarish visions of primal horror, making targets easy prey.

name: Plasma Grenade
description: These grenades match the effectiveness of Imperial Plasma Grenades, but their advanced construction makes them smaller and lighter, allowing Aeldari to carry more.

name: Wireweave Grenade
description: These grenades burst in a mess of monomolecular filament wires, slicing and entangling anyone within the blast, or beneath it as it settles. In addition to the listed damage, any character hit takes 1 Mortal Wound if they move more than half their Speed within the blast radius until the monofilaments settle, 1 Round later.

name: Mono Knife
description: These sturdy blades are forged from high quality materials and honed to a monomolecular edge capable of slicing through even thin metals with ease.

name: Industrial Bludgeon
description: These weapons are repurposed tools forged for heavy industry such as mining, smelting, or construction. Brutish implements designed to wrench, torque, snap, clamp, or carve through plasteel, they prove quite effective when turned against flesh and bone.

name: Chainaxe
description: Combining the tearing action of a Chainsword with the force of an axe swing, Chainaxes can be found in the hands of the most brutal warriors, cutting swathes of grizzly carnage through screaming victims.

name: Chain Fist
description: Designed for use in void ship boarding actions, these upgraded Power Fists sport an underslung Chainblade that proves just as capable of tearing through reinforced fortifications and vehicles as void ship bulkheads.

name: Nemesis Daemon Hammer
description: Wielded amongst the psychically-gifted Inquisitors and the enigmatic Grey Knights, these slow but mighty weapons smite with both physical and psychic energies.

name: Power Klaw
description: These bulky pincers use hydraulic motors to force a set of brutish claws, each shrouded by a sizzling power field, around the unfortunate target, crushing and scything through them with unrelenting force.

name: Big Choppa
description: Massive lumps of metal swung with both hands, Big Choppas are impossibly varied in appearance and material construction, but the end result of their use in the hands of an angry Ork are always dramatic.

name: Chain Choppa
description: A crude approximation of Imperial weapons, Chain Choppas are poorly maintained, fuel guzzling weapons that emit a grating roar and chew through targets in a staggering display of industrialised brutality.

name: Weirdboy Staff
description: Strange assemblages of copper pipes, glass bulbs, and jangling fetish objects, Weirdboy Staffs grant Ork Psykers a modicum of control over their legendarily unpredictable powers.

name: Master-Crafted Laspistol
description: Boasting baroque carvings, rare materials, and poetic names, these upgraded Laspistols are as much about beauty as stopping power, and they have both in spades. Specially commissioned by status conscious nobles and success-blessed gunslingers alike, these weapons are designed to silence matters of personal dispute, in a quick, civilised, and decisive manner.

name: Hot-Shot Volley Gun
description: Two Hellguns twin-linked with an alternating fire system, the Hot-Shot Volley Gun is a weighty, deadly weapon designed to unleash a staggering stream of unrelenting firepower. A Hot-Shot Volley Gun produces a keening howl when unleashed, ionising the air as they punch through their targets.

name: Long Las
description: Manufactured for enhanced range, meticulously fine tuned for accuracy, and powered by single-fire hot-shot magazines, a Long Las is the preferred sniper of the trained Imperial hunter. In the right hands and with the right target, a single Long Las can silence the corrupting demagogue, break an entrenched frontline, or halt a planet-wide uprising before it begins.

name: Lascannon
description: Unwieldy cannons powered by oversized charge packs that thrum with destructive potential, Lascannons are the Imperium's mass produced answer to the armoured terrors of the galaxy. Most often mounted to vehicles or in static defensive positions, they can nonetheless be mobilised by a trained fireteam of two Humans, or one exceptional individual, such as a Space Marine.

name: Plasma Cannon
description: Heavy, dangerous, and stretching the destructive limits of man portable weaponry. Each crackling blast burns brighter than the sun, igniting all in its path and cutting through flesh and steel like they were naught but air.

name: Inferno Pistol
description: The archeotech pattern of the Inferno Pistol is thought lost to time, making these handheld Melta weapons exceptionally prized. Most are heirlooms with storied pasts, handed down through generations.

name: Meltagun
description: Also known as a 'cooker' or 'Fusion Gun', this bulky, rifle-sized Melta weapon finds its use on the frontlines, cracking open fortifications and heavy vehicles with ease. The distinctive hiss of boiling air and the follow uproar of immolating plasteel has been the final obituary for countless tank crews.

name: Multi-Melta
description: The Multi-Melta is the largest infantry mobile Melta weapon in service. Its dual barrels birth a wider and longer-ranged beam of devastation that reduces targets to pools of smouldering slag.

name: Needle Pistol
description: Using elegant but rare and complex mechanisms, these easily concealed dart throwers combine baneful toxicants with laser technology to silently and discreetly dispatch foes.

name: Stubcannon
description: Taking the oversized Stubber to its logical conclusion, these outsized weapons fire large, readily available slugs that make their recipients feel distinctly unlucky.

name: Shotgun
description: Primitive even by the standards set by other slugthrowers, Shotguns provide significant and reliable stopping power at short range.

name: Heavy Stubber
description: This large, belt-fed slugthrower is equally capable of laying down a formidable hail of suppressive fire and cutting through ranks of infantry.

name: Needle Rifle
description: With extended barrels for greater range, these rare rifles deliver the same deadly poisons as Needle Pistols. Firing tiny darts of frozen neuro-toxin along a guiding beam of invisible laser-light, they are near whisper quiet weapons.

name: Astartes Sniper Rifle
description: Firing tiny darts of frozen neuro-toxin along a guiding beam of invisible laser-light, Astartes Sniper Rifles are nearly whisper quiet weapons that drop key targets with stealth and efficiency.

name: Assault Cannon
description: An Assault Cannon is a devastating anti-infantry weapon. With multiple rotating barrels, its astonishing rate of fire can decimate foes, but undisciplined use often leads to inopportune jamming.

name: Autocannon
description: The Autocannon is a widely-used heavy weapon, often pressed into service for anti-infantry or anti-aircraft purposes. Its heavy shells, long range, and high rate of fire makes it a versatile weapon in conflicts across the galaxy.

name: Hand Flamer
description: Common among acolytes of the Inquisition and Redemptionist adherents, this is a pocket-sized inferno just waiting to be unleashed, with its only limit on potential carnage being its shallow fuel reservoirs.

name: Flamer
description: A brutally simple mechanism; sticky, liquid Promethium is propelled down the barrel and across a steady pilot light. The stream of ignited liquid adheres to any surface it touches, melting flesh and plasteel.

name: Heavy Flamer
description: Often sporting multiple barrels and hefty tanks to fuel them, Heavy Flamers cast streaming arcs of liquid flame across the battlefield. They specialise in flooding trenches and buildings in an all-consuming nightmare of hellfire.

name: Arc Pistol
description: A miniaturised Arc weapon favoured by Skitarii Rangers, this handgun is capable of discharging violent outbursts of concentrated energy at close range.

name: Galvanic Rifle
description: Harkening to ancient flintlock weapons, Galvanic Rifles fire electromagnetic, servitor-guided projectiles, each endowed with a savage machine spirit obsessed with inflicting maximum devastation to their target.

name: Arc Rifle
description: Powered by energy capacitors built in the dawn of the Imperium, these rifles fire crackling bolts of iridescent lightning that scorch flesh, overload neural impulses, and fry machinery with a single blast.

name: Radium Carbine
description: These baroque weapons fire a torrent of solid projectiles so hyper-irradiated that they birth horrifying radiation storms upon use, ripping apart the genetic structure of target and wielder alike.

name: Volkite Blaster
description: Archaic relics of past eras, Volkite weapons direct focused beams of inferno-strength heat over range to melt enemies from the inside out.

name: Frag Grenade
description: Compact, easily manufactured, and so simple even the most disconnected feral worlder can use them; frag grenades are the anti-personnel explosive of choice across the Imperium.

name: Krak Grenade
description: Comparable to Frag Grenades, but stuffed with excessive explosive agents and encased in a shaped charge casing. Designed to crack open fortifications and vehicles, they are most often affixed to their targets and detonated via timer or remote, though it is not unheard of for desperate soldiers to use them in a more traditional manner.

name: Militarum Tempestus Grenade Launcher
description: This drum-fed grenade launcher can lob explosives at a distance and rate that transforms a lowly soldier into a terrifying deathbringer. Powerful recoil may leave them bruised, their hearing may be permanently damaged, and lugging its hazardous ammunition causes other soldiers to give them a wide berth, but none deny wielding these destructive weapons is often intoxicating.

name: Frag Missile
description: At the core of this missile lies a bundle of concentrated anti-personnel explosives that detonate on impact, casting ragged flesh-shredding shrapnel across a wide area.

name: Krak Missile
description: These missiles are crowned with powerful shaped charges that punch through armoured targets with an ear-rupturing implosive force.

name: Missile Launcher
description: Simple in design, Missile Launchers are often little more than plasteel tubes with foolproof trigger mechanisms rigged to send their self-propelled payloads streaking towards their unfortunate targets.

name: Cyclone Missile Launcher
description: Equipped with fast-loading twin ammunition racks, this missile launcher was designed for armour-clad Tactical Dreadnaught Terminators, to lay down an unrelenting barrage of explosive ruin upon enemies of the Imperium. You load this weapon with 2 missile Ammo of the same type, and fire them both as one attack.

name: Fusion Gun
description: Similar in function to Melta weapons, Fusion Guns hyper-agitate their target's molecules to terrifying effect. The resulting heat and energy causes instant immolation and the vaporisation of everything around the target.

name: Burna
description: Leaking flame weapons that spew any mix of flammable liquids their owner can find, Burnas are dangerous and unpredictable weapons that can even be used as impromptu welding torches should the need arise.

name: Big Shoota
description: These massive, fully-automatic weapons are essentially scaled up Shootas, belching a cacophonous stream of oversized ammunition that bring a toothed smile to nearby Orks.

name: Snazzgun
description: A Snazzgun is a unique, custom-built weapon created by a Mekboy. No two are alike, and each one is as unpredictable as the Ork that built it.

name: Rokkit Launcha
description: Ork Rokkit Launchas are crude but effective explosive launchers. Each rokkit is a self-propelled explosive that streaks towards its target trailing smoke and sparks.

name: Stikkbomb
description: Stikkbombs are crude Ork grenades, typically made from a tin can stuffed with explosive and nails, attached to a stick for throwing. Despite their primitive construction, they are surprisingly effective.
